Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Bloody \Blood"y\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Bloodied}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Bloodying}.] To stain with blood. --Overbury. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
bloodied \blood"ied\ adj. Covered with blood.
Syn: gory, sanguinary. [WordNet 1.5]
bloodied adj : having been caused to bleed; "a bloodied nose"

bloody adj 1: having or covered with or accompanied by blood; "a bloody nose"; "your scarf is all bloody"; "the effects will be violent and probably bloody"; "a bloody fight" [ant: {bloodless}] 2: (used of persons) informal intensifiers; "what a bally (or blinking) nuisance"; "a bloody fool"; "a crashing bore"; "you flaming idiot" [syn: {bally(a)}, {blinking(a)}, {bloody(a)}, {blooming(a)}, {crashing(a)}, {flaming(a)}, {fucking(a)}] adv : extremely; "you are bloody right"; "Why are you so all-fired aggressive?" [syn: {damn}, {all-fired}] v : cover with blood; "bloody your hands" [also: {bloodied}, {bloodiest}, {bloodier}]
